sen.j: 二軒茶屋駅（にけんちゃやえき）は、京都市左京区にある叡山電鉄叡山電鉄鞍馬線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in the Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, the Nikenchaya Station is a stop on the Kurama Line, the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Nikenchaya Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Nikenchaya Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).

sen.j: かつて鞍馬などへ行く旅人のための茶屋が2軒あったことが駅名の由来だが、茶屋は古くになくなっている。
sen.e: The Nikenchaya Station was named after two ("niken") tea houses ("chaya") existed for travelers going to Kurama in old days, but the tea houses disappeared long time ago.
sen.cmt: 「二軒茶屋駅」の駅名の由来について、意味とそれに相当する読み（アルファベット）を加えました。
sen.e: Nikenchaya Station was named after two ("niken") teahouses ("chaya") that existed for travelers going to Kurama in the old days, but the teahouses have long since disappeared.
Nikenchaya Station was named after two (niken) teahouses (chaya) that existed for travelers going to Kurama in the old days, but the teahouses have long since disappeared.

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ無人駅。
sen.e: An unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks which face each other.
It is an unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks facing each other.
It is an unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks facing each other.

sen.j: ホームの鞍馬駅側に駅構内踏切（第1種甲）があり、両ホームを結んでいる。
sen.e: Two platforms are accessed by a level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko) located on the Kurama Station side of the platforms.
Two platforms are accessed by a level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko) located on the Kurama Station side of the platforms.
Two platforms are accessed by a level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko) located on the Kurama Station side of the platforms.

sen.j: 出入口は踏切の鞍馬行ホーム側。
sen.e: An entrance is located on the Kurama-bound platform.
An entrance is located on the Kurama-bound platform.
An entrance is located on the Kurama-bound platform.

sen.j: 鞍馬寄りに片渡り線2組があり、その先は上り線側が単線の本線、下り線側が引上線となっている。
sen.e: There are two pairs of single crossovers on the Kurama side followed by a single main track on the inbound side and a lead track on the outbound side.
There are two pairs of single crossovers on the Kurama side, followed by a single main track on the inbound side and a lead track on the outbound side.
There are two pairs of single crossovers on the Kurama side, followed by a single main track on the inbound side and a lead track on the outbound side.

sen.j: 引上線は出町柳方面からの同駅折返し列車が使用している。
sen.e: Trains from Demachiyanagi which arrive at and depart from the station use the lead track.
Trains from Demachiyanagi that arrive at and depart from the station use the lead track.
Trains from Demachiyanagi that arrive at and depart from the station use the lead track.

sen.j: 鞍馬方面ホームにのみ自動改札機が設置されている。
sen.e: An automatic ticket gate is installed only on the Kurama-bound platform.
An automatic ticket gate is installed only on the Kurama-bound platform.
An automatic ticket gate is installed only on the Kurama-bound platform.

sen.j: 回数券の一部は大学前のファミリーマート京都産業大学店で発売している。
sen.e: Part of commutation tickets are sold at the FamilyMart Kyoto Sangyo-daigakuten in front of the university.
Some of the commuter tickets are sold at the FamilyMart Kyoto Sangyo-daigakuten in front of the university.
Some of the commuter tickets are sold at the FamilyMart Kyoto Sangyo-daigakuten in front of the university.

sen.j: 踏切からホームへは、レール面からホーム面までのゆるい階段のみであるが、駅自体が山の斜面にかかった所にあるので（画像参照）車椅子等での利用は困難。
sen.e: From the level crossing to the platforms can be accessed only by gentle stairs from the track level to the platform level, and the station is located on the mountainside, which makes the accessibility for a person in wheelchairs limited (refer to the image).

The route from the level crossing to the platforms can be accessed only by gentle stairs from the track level to the platform level, and the station is located on the mountainside, which makes for limited accessibility by persons in wheelchairs (refer to the image).

The route from the level crossing to the platforms can be accessed only by gentle stairs from the track level to the platform level, and the station is located on the mountainside, which makes for limited accessibility by persons in wheelchairs (refer to the image).

sen.j: 京都府道38号京都広河原美山線とは反対側の山の斜面にある。
sen.e: The station is located on the mountainside which is the other side of the Kyoto-hirogawara-miyamasen Kyoto Fudo 38 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 38) (Kurama-kaido).
The station is located on a mountainside, and on the other side is the Kyoto-hirogawara-miyamasen Kyoto Fudo 38 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 38) (Kurama-kaido).
The station is located on a mountainside, and on the other side is the Kyoto-hirogawara-miyama Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 38 (Kurama-kaido).
sen.cmt: Kyoto-hirogawara-miyama Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 38としました。

sen.j: 沿線は山に囲まれた住宅街である。
sen.e: The line sits in a residential area surrounded by mountains.
The line is situated in a residential area surrounded by mountains.
The line is situated in a residential area surrounded by mountains.

sen.j: 駅裏の高台には京都産業大学の第2グラウンドがある。
sen.e: On a rise behind the station lies the second field of the Kyoto Sangyo University.
On a rise behind the station lies the second field of Kyoto Sangyo University.
On a rise behind the station lies the second field of Kyoto Sangyo University.

sen.j: 洛北病院
sen.e: Rakuhoku Hospital
Rakuhoku Hospital
Rakuhoku Hospital

sen.j: 京都産業大学（徒歩の場合約800m）
sen.e: Kyoto Sangyo University (about 800 km on foot)
Kyoto Sangyo University (about 800 km on foot)
Kyoto Sangyo University (about 800 meters on foot)

sen.j: バスのりば
sen.e: Bus stop
Bus stop
Bus stop

sen.j: 二軒茶屋（駅から府道に出た所）
sen.e: Nikenchaya (on the Prefecture Road from the station)
Nikenchaya (on the prefectural road from the station)
Nikenchaya (on the prefectural route from the station)

sen.j: 京都バス
sen.e: Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus

sen.j: 二軒茶屋駅（駅前のバス回転場）
sen.e: Nikenchaya Station (a rotary in front of the station)
Nikenchaya Station (a rotary in front of the station)
Nikenchaya Station (a rotary in front of the station)

sen.j: 京都産業大学へのスクールバス「二軒茶屋シャトルバス」（京都バスが運行）
sen.e: Nikenchaya Shuttle Bus' is the school bus to the Kyoto Sangyo University (operated by the Kyoto Bus).
Nikenchaya Shuttle Bus' is the school bus to the Kyoto Sangyo University (operated by the Kyoto Bus).
Nikenchaya Shuttle Bus' is the school bus to the Kyoto Sangyo University (operated by the Kyoto Bus).

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）12月1日 鞍馬電気鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: The station opened on December 1, 1928, as a station owned by the Kurama Electric Railway.
The station opened on December 1, 1928, as a station owned by the Kurama Electric Railway.
December 1, 1928: The station opened as a station owned by the Kurama Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1939年（昭和14年）9月 当駅～市原駅間が、戦争に伴う資材供出のため単線化。
sen.e: In September 1939, the line between the Nikenchaya Station and the Ichihara Station became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.
In September 1939, the line between Nikenchaya Station and Ichihara Station became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.
September 1939: The line between Nikenchaya Station and Ichihara Station became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）8月1日 会社合併により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On August 1, 1942, the station came to be owned by the Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of amalgamation.
On August 1, 1942, the station came to be owned by the Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of amalgamation.
August 1, 1942: The station came to be owned by the Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）11月10日 山端（現・宝ヶ池駅）～当駅間が、戦争に伴う資材供出のため単線化。
sen.e: On November 10, 1944, the line between the Yamabana Station (currently called Takaragaike Station) and the Nikenchaya Station became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.
On November 10, 1944, the line between the Yamabana Station (currently called Takaragaike Station) and the Nikenchaya Station became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.
November 10, 1944: The line between Yamabana Station (currently called Takaragaike Station) and Nikenchaya Station became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

sen.j: 上りホームを構内踏切の手前（北側）に移設。
sen.e: The inbound platform was transferred besides (on the north side of) the level crossing in the station.
The inbound platform was transferred alongside (on the north side of) the level crossing in the station.
The inbound platform was transferred alongside (on the north side of) the level crossing in the station.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 会社再編により叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1986, the station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of reorganization of companies.
On April 1, 1986, the station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of the reorganization of companies.
April 1, 1986: The station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of the reorganization of companies.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）9月28日 岩倉駅 (京都府)～当駅間が再複線化。
sen.e: On September 28, 1990, the line between the Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and the Nikenchaya Station became a double track again.
On September 28, 1990, the line between the Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nikenchaya Station became a double track again.
September 28, 1990: The line between Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nikenchaya Station became a double track again.

sen.j: 上りホームを構内踏切の先（南側・下りホームの対向位置）に移設。
sen.e: The inbound platform was moved just next to the the level cross in the station (i.e., on the south side facing the outbound platform).
The inbound platform was moved just next to the the level cross in the station (i.e., on the south side facing the outbound platform).
The inbound platform was moved just next to the the level cross in the station (i.e., on the south side facing the outbound platform).

sen.j: 叡山電鉄
sen.e: Eizan Electric Railway
Eizan Electric Railway
Eizan Electric Railway

sen.j: 鞍馬線
sen.e: Kurama Line
Kurama Line
Kurama Line

sen.j: 京都精華大前駅 - 二軒茶屋駅 - 市原駅
sen.e: Kyoto Seikadaimae Station - Nikenchaya Station - Ichihara Station
Kyoto Seikadaimae Station - Nikenchaya Station - Ichihara Station
